dtliExcerpt: This is a brilliant piece of work that uses Shakespeare's 'Hamlet' as a jumping-off point for a deeply personal exploration of Black masculinity, family trauma and the cycles of violence that can define generations.
bwwExcerpt: But there is nothing dour or overly academic about “Fat Ham,” which has been given a blisteringly well-acted production helmed by director Saheem Ali and staged on the wittiest of satirical sets from Maruti Evans. At no point does this play feel like anything other than a big-fun Broadway show: it’s...
